intro: Adenocalymma prehensile, commonly known as the climbing adenocalymma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stem and climbing habit. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are alternate and simple, with a velvety texture. Adenocalymma prehensile is often found in humid, tropical environments and thrives in well-drained soil.
